event.partner: Well done! You are on time.
event.title: player is on time
event.content: But the project manager is not there yet. Even after 10 minutes of waiting you have no notice from him. What are you going to do?
event.option: I call him and complain about his delay
I call him to politely inform that I already arrived at the office
I will wait and inform the front desk about my arrival

event.partner: Okay you are a little bit early.
event.title: player is early
event.content: What are you going to do?
event.option: I will wait until 10.00 am before I do something
I call the project manager and inform him about my early arrival
I will inform the front desk about my early arrival and then I will wait

event.title: player is late
event.content: But the project manager is also not there. What are you going to do?
event.option: I call the project manager to apologize about my late arrival
I call the project manager and complain angrily that he haven't arrived even after half an hour of waiting
I will inform the front desk about my late arrival

event.title: Advice
event.content: It was a good decision to inform the projectmanager or the front desk. Spain is very performance oriented country and you have shown your engagement.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is impolite to attack the projektmanager. Especially in Spain where power distance is rather high, it is inappropriate to attack your boss.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It was a bad decision to waste time in front of the office. Spain is very performance oriented country so you have to show your engagement.

event.messageBoxA: Buenos días %prename%, comó estás? I hope you had a comfortable travel to Madrid.
event.messageBoxB: Hello. Nice to meet you.
event.messageBoxA: I'm very sorry for my delay. But it is almost 11. So we should hurry up to be punctual for our weekly project meeting. Please follow me.
Okay we are a little bit late.
event.messageBoxB: Where are the others?
event.messageBoxA: They are also late. Don’t worry they will be here soon.

event.title: Projektmeeting2
event.content: I can’t understand anything about the content. Why he is speaking in Spanish? I should intervene here. Otherwise this meeting makes no sense for me. But can I interrupt him the during his presentation?
event.option: Maybe I should just keep the meeting ongoing without interruption
I should interrupt him to ask politely if he can continue in English
I should interrupt him to tell him angrily that he has to continue in English

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is politey not to disturb the projectmanager while he is presenting. But the whole meeting will not make any sense for you in Spanish.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is appropriate to ask the projectmanager politely to continue in English. Otherwise the whole meeting will not make any sense for you.

event.title: Advice 3: Spieler geht den Projektmanager an
event.content: It is impolite to attack the projektmanager in front of his team members. Especially in Spain where power distance is rather high, it is inappropriate to attack your boss.

event.title: Projektmeeting3
event.content: And this is insane. It seems like everybody is doing what they want in a very unprofessional and impolite way. In Germany you never could go for coffee or cigarette during an important status meeting. This way there will be never clear communication about the project status and ongoing tasks. Slowly I realize why the project needs consultancy. I really should react immediately.
event.option: I should definitely intervene and say: "Sorry that I have to interrupt. But this can’t go on like that. If you desire a successful project outcome you have to listen the status presentation and contribute your input. You behavior is unprofessional.”

I should definitely intervene and say: "Sorry that I have to interrupt. But we should think about some meeting rules here. To achieve our goals it is important that everybody is on the same page regards status and ongoing tasks. I have some good experiences that I would like to share with you.”
Maybe I should just keep the meeting ongoing without interruption and afterwards I can talk individually to the project members about their behaviour
Maybe I should do nothing. It seems if this behaviour is accepted by everybody including the project manager

event.title: Spieler unterbricht Meeting und weißt die Anderen zurecht
event.content: It is impolite to interrupt the meeting. Furthermore, in countries with high power distance, it is the projectmanager's task to adivce the other team members of their behaviour.

event.title: Spieler unterbricht das Meeting und fordert Einführung von Meeting Rules
event.content: It is impolite to interrupt the meeting. But the introduction of meeting rules shows your engangement and will improve future meetings.

event.title: Spieler weißt die Teammember einzeln auf ihr Verhalten hin
event.content: It is very polite not to advise the other team members in front of the project manager.

event.title: Spieler unternimmt nichts
event.content: Doing nothing is not appropriate. You need to intervene here!

event.messageBoxA: %prename%, this will be your workplace during the project. I’m going for my lunch break at home to my family. There is no cantina here but across the street, there is a good restaurant with a special lunch menu. Other employees resign a big lunch break and just get something from the bistro to leave the office earlier.
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for your advice. I will go to the restaurant.
event.messageBoxA: Okay. See you later. ¡Hasta luego!
event.messageBoxB: See you later.

event.partner: After one hour lunch break, back in the office.
event.title: Back in the office.
event.content: I should discuss the next steps with the chief of HR to finish the planning tomorrow.

event.messageBoxA: Hello, my name is %prename%, I am the german consultant for the relocation project.
event.messageBoxB: ¡Hola %prename%! Nice to meet you! I am Carmen. I am the Chief's secretary.
event.messageBoxA: I am in charge of moving your department and would like to discuss some points with the chief.
event.messageBoxB: I am very sorry, but the chief is at home for the lunch break. He will be back about 15.30. Shall I leave him a notice?
event.messageBoxA: It's an urgent topic. I need to talk to him immediately. Could you give me his phone number?
event.messageBoxB: Here you got his card with the contact information.
event.messageBoxA: Thanks.
event.messageBoxB: ¡De nada!

event.title: Diskussion HR 1
event.content: I don’t really I get it. How can this company run if one half of the employees takes 3 hours lunch breaks while the other half is leaving at 4 pm? Especially leadership positions. I don’t want to sit around here doing nothing to discuss afterwards the project plan until late evening. Maybe I just should call him and ask if he could return earlier for once.
event.option: I will call him and ask: "Hello Mr. Chief of HR, I am %prename%, the German project consultant. Would it be possible for you to return to the office a little bit earlier. We really need to finish the planning for your department relocation the day after tomorrow."

I will call him and request: "Hello Mr. Chief of HR. Here is %prename%, I can't understand how you can take cozily lunch at home while we have to finish urgently our department relocation for the day after tomorrow."
I will not disturb the Chief of HR during his lunch break. I will adapt to the Spanish work mentality.

event.messageBoxA: I understand. I will finish my lunch break and contact you afterwards. Bye.
event.messageBoxB: Okay see you later. Thanks for your understanding.

event.messageBoxA: Who do you think you are? I am the Chief of HR and you interrupt me during my lunch break with the family.
event.messageBoxB: But I have an important topic to discuss.
event.messageBoxA: You talk to my assistance and never call me on this number again!
¡Cabrón!
event.messageBoxB: But...

event.title: Timekiller
event.content: Okay I need to kill some time before I can clarify the planning. I need a month ticket for the metro anyway. Maybe I just order it now.

event.messageBoxA: Hello %prename%, here you got the information about the resources of the first 5 employees of the HR move tomorrow afternoon. The coordination planning is still not done. Please figure out for which tasks we need external experts.
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for the information. I will start the planing right now.

event.title: Zeitplanung
event.description: Please decide which tasks can be done by company internal employees and for which external experts are necessary:

option.title: Equip the workplaces with office supplies
Move important documents and files to the new workplace
Install network supplies for every new workplace
Moving the private stuff of the employees to the new workplace
Security Representative has to check the office
Installing PCs and telecomunication for every workplace

event.title: Problem Zulieferer
event.content: The furniture supplier is already 20 minutes late. If they’re not coming soon my whole schedule will fail. If my IT-guys are here at the same time they will disturb each other. I should call them to clarify.
event.option: I will call him and ask: "Hello Furniture Man, could you tell me when you will arrive approximately?"

I will call him and tell him: "Hello Furniture Man, please hurry up. You are already 20 minutes too late. It is very important to follow the exact schedule. Otherwise we cannot finish the project today!"
I will not call him because the furniture will certainly arrive within the next minutes.

event.title: Nach der Ankunftszeit erkundingen
event.content: In performance oriented countries it is okay to ask when the supplier will arrive. With your question you politely remind him that he is late.

event.title: Furniture man angehen
event.content: It is impolite to attack the furniture man. This will only make him arriving later.

event.title: Nicht anrufen
event.content: It is too risky not to call the furniture man. If he arrives too late the whole removal cannot be completed. In performance oriented countries it is okay to ask when the supplier will arrive.

event.messageBoxA: Your plan seemed to be perfect. My assistant was already in the office to check if everything is finished. So my employees can start now moving their stuff at the planned time. Muchas gracias, %prename%.
event.messageBoxB: Great news! It was a pleasure.

event.messageBoxA: To celebrate the project success I would propose to go out somewhere with the whole team. To thank our guest from Germany I would let him choose what we should do
event.messageBoxB: I would propose to visit a bullfight because I would take part in this cultural spectacle.
I would propose to visit a flamenco evening.
I would propose to go to a tapas bar to take some tapas and beer.

event.messageBoxA: Me and the majority oft he Madrileños are strictly against the bullfights and the brutal killing of animals. By the way the company itself fights to forbid these events in the whole country.
event.messageBoxB: Okay. So then let's go to a tapas bar. I will visit the bullfight alone before.

event.title: Bullfight
event.content: The bullfight has already started.

event.messageBoxA: You know that flamenco is Andalusian culture? If you find flamenco in Madrid it will be poor and only touristic orientated.
event.messageBoxB: Okay. So then let's go to a tapas bar.

event.messageBoxA: Yeah that’s awesome, let’s have some fun together!
event.messageBoxB: Great. I am looking forward to today's evening.

event.title: Fiesta Planung 2
event.content: Evening at a Tapas Bar

event.messageBoxA: Okay guys it was a really nice evening with you, but it is late and we should have some sleep before we get back to the office. I will order the bill.

event.title: Fiesta Rechnung
event.content: The waiter is bringing the bill. Another colleague
event.option: Okay I calculated it. It’s about 30 Euro on everyone.

event.title: 4-Ohren-Modell
event.option: He thinks his calculation is right and everybody will follow.
We are all equal, so everybody should pay the same.
He wants me to put 30 Euros in the bowl.
The price divided by all team members is 30 Euros.

event.title: Fiesta Rechnung
event.content: As I calculated it I only spend 10 euros on my beverages. Why the hell should I finance their evening? I should definitely clarify this!
event.option: I should go to the waiter and pay him directly.
I should put 10 euros and one euro tip into the bill bowl.
Although I didn't spend 30 euros I should pay them.

event.title: Beim Kellner bezalen
event.content: In Spain you usually pay your bill together in a group. It is seen as impolite and not common to pay the bill individually.

event.title: Advice
event.content: In Spain you usually pay your bill together in a group. It is very common to divide the bill by the number of guests.

event.title: Advice 3
event.content: In Spain you usually pay your bill together in a group and divide the bill by the number of guests.

event.title: Job Offering
event.content: Are you willing to accept this exciting Job Offer?

event.title: Emotional Entry Video
event.content: While your are going by train, you can watch this informational video about Madrid

event.partner: You arrived at Attocha Renfe main station at 9:00
event.title: Arrival at the train station
event.content: You have to take the metro to get to the headquater where you have the appointment with the project manager at 10:00

event.partner: Study the metro plan. The headquarter is located at Plaza de Castilla
event.title: Metro Connection Selection
event.content: Please choose a metro connection to the headquarter where you have an appointment at 10:00 with the project manager
event.option: From Atocha Renfe to Plaza de Castilla, Departure: 9:30, Arrival: 9:55
From Atocha Renfe via Tribunal to Plaza de Castilla,Departure: 9:15, Arrival: 9:30
From Atocha Renfe via Sol via Principe de Vergara to Plaza de Castilla, Departure: 9:30, Arrival: 10:15

event.partner: Well done! You are on time.
event.title: player is on time
event.content: But the project manager is not there yet. Even after 10 minutes of waiting you have no notice from him. What are you going to do?
event.option: I call him and complain about his delay
I call him to politely inform that I already arrived at the office
I will wait and inform the front desk about my arrival

event.partner: Okay you are a little bit early.
event.title: player is early
event.content: What are you going to do?
event.option: I will wait until 10.00 am before I do something
I call the project manager and inform him about my early arrival
I will inform the front desk about my early arrival and then I will wait

event.title: player is late
event.content: But the project manager is also not there. What are you going to do?
event.option: I call the project manager to apologize about my late arrival
I call the project manager and complain angrily that he haven't arrived even after half an hour of waiting
I will inform the front desk about my late arrival

event.title: Advice
event.content: It was a good decision to inform the projectmanager or the front desk. Spain is very performance oriented country and you have shown your engagement.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is impolite to attack the projektmanager. Especially in Spain where power distance is rather high, it is inappropriate to attack your boss.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It was a bad decision to waste time in front of the office. Spain is very performance oriented country so you have to show your engagement.

event.messageBoxA: Buenos días %prename%, comó estás? I hope you had a comfortable travel to Madrid.
event.messageBoxB: Hello. Nice to meet you.
event.messageBoxA: I'm very sorry for my delay. But it is almost 11. So we should hurry up to be punctual for our weekly project meeting. Please follow me.
Okay we are a little bit late.
event.messageBoxB: Where are the others?
event.messageBoxA: They are also late. Don’t worry they will be here soon.

event.title: Projektmeeting2
event.content: I can’t understand anything about the content. Why he is speaking in Spanish? I should intervene here. Otherwise this meeting makes no sense for me. But can I interrupt him the during his presentation?
event.option: Maybe I should just keep the meeting ongoing without interruption
I should interrupt him to ask politely if he can continue in English
I should interrupt him to tell him angrily that he has to continue in English

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is politey not to disturb the projectmanager while he is presenting. But the whole meeting will not make any sense for you in Spanish.

event.title: Advice
event.content: It is appropriate to ask the projectmanager politely to continue in English. Otherwise the whole meeting will not make any sense for you.

event.title: Advice 3: Spieler geht den Projektmanager an
event.content: It is impolite to attack the projektmanager in front of his team members. Especially in Spain where power distance is rather high, it is inappropriate to attack your boss.

event.title: Projektmeeting3
event.content: And this is insane. It seems like everybody is doing what they want in a very unprofessional and impolite way. In Germany you never could go for coffee or cigarette during an important status meeting. This way there will be never clear communication about the project status and ongoing tasks. Slowly I realize why the project needs consultancy. I really should react immediately.
event.option: I should definitely intervene and say: "Sorry that I have to interrupt. But this can’t go on like that. If you desire a successful project outcome you have to listen the status presentation and contribute your input. You behavior is unprofessional.”

I should definitely intervene and say: "Sorry that I have to interrupt. But we should think about some meeting rules here. To achieve our goals it is important that everybody is on the same page regards status and ongoing tasks. I have some good experiences that I would like to share with you.”
Maybe I should just keep the meeting ongoing without interruption and afterwards I can talk individually to the project members about their behaviour
Maybe I should do nothing. It seems if this behaviour is accepted by everybody including the project manager

event.title: Spieler unterbricht Meeting und weißt die Anderen zurecht
event.content: It is impolite to interrupt the meeting. Furthermore, in countries with high power distance, it is the projectmanager's task to adivce the other team members of their behaviour.

event.title: Spieler unterbricht das Meeting und fordert Einführung von Meeting Rules
event.content: It is impolite to interrupt the meeting. But the introduction of meeting rules shows your engangement and will improve future meetings.

event.title: Spieler weißt die Teammember einzeln auf ihr Verhalten hin
event.content: It is very polite not to advise the other team members in front of the project manager.

event.title: Spieler unternimmt nichts
event.content: Doing nothing is not appropriate. You need to intervene here!

event.messageBoxA: %prename%, this will be your workplace during the project. I’m going for my lunch break at home to my family. There is no cantina here but across the street, there is a good restaurant with a special lunch menu. Other employees resign a big lunch break and just get something from the bistro to leave the office earlier.
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for your advice. I will go to the restaurant.
event.messageBoxA: Okay. See you later. ¡Hasta luego!
event.messageBoxB: See you later.

event.partner: After one hour lunch break, back in the office.
event.title: Back in the office.
event.content: I should discuss the next steps with the chief of HR to finish the planning tomorrow.

event.messageBoxA: Hello, my name is %prename%, I am the german consultant for the relocation project.
event.messageBoxB: ¡Hola %prename%! Nice to meet you! I am Carmen. I am the Chief's secretary.
event.messageBoxA: I am in charge of moving your department and would like to discuss some points with the chief.
event.messageBoxB: I am very sorry, but the chief is at home for the lunch break. He will be back about 15.30. Shall I leave him a notice?
event.messageBoxA: It's an urgent topic. I need to talk to him immediately. Could you give me his phone number?
event.messageBoxB: Here you got his card with the contact information.
event.messageBoxA: Thanks.
event.messageBoxB: ¡De nada!

event.title: Diskussion HR 1
event.content: I don’t really I get it. How can this company run if one half of the employees takes 3 hours lunch breaks while the other half is leaving at 4 pm? Especially leadership positions. I don’t want to sit around here doing nothing to discuss afterwards the project plan until late evening. Maybe I just should call him and ask if he could return earlier for once.
event.option: I will call him and ask: "Hello Mr. Chief of HR, I am %prename%, the German project consultant. Would it be possible for you to return to the office a little bit earlier. We really need to finish the planning for your department relocation the day after tomorrow."

I will call him and request: "Hello Mr. Chief of HR. Here is %prename%, I can't understand how you can take cozily lunch at home while we have to finish urgently our department relocation for the day after tomorrow."
I will not disturb the Chief of HR during his lunch break. I will adapt to the Spanish work mentality.

event.messageBoxA: I understand. I will finish my lunch break and contact you afterwards. Bye.
event.messageBoxB: Okay see you later. Thanks for your understanding.

event.messageBoxA: Who do you think you are? I am the Chief of HR and you interrupt me during my lunch break with the family.
event.messageBoxB: But I have an important topic to discuss.
event.messageBoxA: You talk to my assistance and never call me on this number again!
¡Cabrón!
event.messageBoxB: But...

event.title: Timekiller
event.content: Okay I need to kill some time before I can clarify the planning. I need a month ticket for the metro anyway. Maybe I just order it now.

event.title: WorldMap
event.description: Where on the Cultural World Map is Sweden?

event.description26: Give it a try! Rate country Sweden in each of the 9 Dimensions.

event.message: The journey begins...
The ferry arrives at the harbor of Stockholm. Your new colleagues are waiting.

event.messageBoxA: Välkommen %prename% to our beautiful country Sweden! My name is Hans, I am the manager of sales department. This is Lotta, head of the subsidiary here in Sweden. We are two of your new colleagues!
event.messageBoxB: Hi, I am %prename%, it's a pleasure to meet you!

event.messageBoxA: How was your journey, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: There were no problems, I enjoyed the panoramic view.
Pretty bad, unfortunately I got seasick. That's your fault because of your strange traditional ferry.

event.messageBoxA: I feel sorry for you, I know exactly what you mean, I get seasick every time. That's why I travel by plane or car.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hi, I am Lotta. It is a pleasure to meet you. Well, we ordered a taxi which brings you to your accommodation and afterwards to the office. Tonight we would like to invite you to a typical Swedish tradition. We will have a sauna with some colleagues to get to know each other. It would be great if you join us.
event.messageBoxB: Thank you for inviting me. I am looking forward to join you. I really like that.
Sure, that sounds nice, thank you!
No, I don't like sauna.
Oh,well .. I don't know .. I'd rather rest after this long journey.

event.messageBoxA: Oh no, we scheduled this get-together especially for you. It would be really sad if you couldn't make it. Please reconsider your decision.
event.messageBoxB: All right, let's do this.
Okay, if you insist I will join you!

event.messageBoxA: Perfect, that will be fun! Let's meet up at 6 p.m. at Hellasgarden. See you later! Hej da!
event.messageBoxB: Okay see you!

event.messageBoxA: Välkommen to a typical Swedish sauna, %prename%. You already know Lotta, please meet Laura, our German colleague.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey , %prename%, nice to meet you. I have been working here for a few months.
event.messageBoxB: Hi Laura, it's a pleasure. It's getting pretty hot in here, isn't it? Eh .. I mean .. the sauna. Do you do that regularly?

event.messageBoxA: Yes, that's totally normal in our team. Has everything worked out after we left you at the harbor? I'm curious, how is your accommodation?
event.messageBoxB: The taxi driver was funny, and the accommodation is perfect.
Yes, thanks for the organization!
No! I think I paid way too much, why did you chose this driver? But with the accommodation everything is fine.
The apartment is pretty nice, but I have to say: It looks like an Ikea catalog. However, the area around it seems beautiful. It is located near the Nobelmuseum.

event.messageBoxA: Oh cool! Indeed, it is one of the most beautiful areas in Stockholm. And I live there as well. I can give you some advice for grovery shopping, restaurants and bars, if you like.
event.messageBoxB: Yes, that would be great.

event.messageBoxA: Toppen! I have to say: That's a glorious team; I'm really looking forward to collaborate with you. How about we have something to eat now? We could have a Falafel, that's typical Swedish. Stockholm's best one is just around the corner.
event.messageBoxB: So come on, let's go.

event.message: Conference room - MalmöMässan preparation

event.messageBoxA: Good morning together! Thanks for being punctual. We want to welcome our new colleague %prename% once again. Now to the business: as all of you know, our sales department here in Stockholm was established not very long ago. But nevertheless our German general management says that it cannot be seen as an excuse for our bad figures. In the upcoming months there are many business fairs where we need to develop new business contacts. This is where our new German colleague fits in the story: %prename% will be responsible for the whole client communication for the HQ while I will be representing our sales office here in Stockholm. Now it's up to you, %prename%!
event.messageBoxB: Thank you for the introduction!

Also from my part a very Välkommen. The next few months will be an interesting experience for me. I hope everything will become well and in the end we will be successful. But now, enough for the talking, let's focus on the preparation for the business fair in two weeks in Malmö!
Talk to Lotta

event.messageBoxA: %prename%, please meet me in my office after this discussion. You need to design our new business cards!
event.messageBoxB: Okay!

event.messageBoxA: Hi! Thanks for meeting me here so quickly. The task is to redesign our new business cards. Can you take a look on this topic?
event.messageBoxB: Let's do this!

event.title: Business card draft
event.description: Please design our new business cards. Which elements should be on the business card?

event.messageBoxA: Good job! In Sweden, titles are not so important due to the flat hierarchies in business life. Do you remember? Power distance in Sweden in the 9 Dimensions Quiz was ranked low.
event.messageBoxB: Okay!

event.message: MalmöMässan

event.messageBoxA: Welcome everybody! Thanks for joining to the MalmöMässan! Our focus today is on some maybe in the future clients. Leader is %prename%, the team consists of Lotta and Laura, too. Nu går vi, let's go!
event.messageBoxB: Next

event.messageBoxA: For the first day of this business fair, I prepared a little game: the one of us, who receives the most of the business cards of our clients gets a meal on my costs.
event.messageBoxB: Go and talk to Gunnar

event.messageBoxA: Hi there! I am Gunnar from SvenskeIT. Nice to meet you!
event.messageBoxB: Hi Gunnar, nice to meet you, I am %prename%. How are you doing? Did your day begin well?
Hi Gunnar, I am not a fan of small talk, so let's talk business.
Hi Gunnar, I am %prename%. Can I offer you a drink? Is everything okay?

event.messageBoxA: Yes, thanks. I am fine. It's the first time for us at this business fair, we are new on the market. Since when are you working for Tyron Technologies?
event.messageBoxB: I have been working for my company for four years in Germany, and since a few weeks here in Sweden. How is the business development for you?
I moved here a few weeks ago. How is the business?

event.messageBoxA: The business development is a long process, that's why I am talking to you. What can you offer me as benefits of a coorporation with your company?
event.messageBoxB: Researches have shown that our product is one of the best in the market. The German engineering is known for its quality and we are set on to keep our reputation clear. Quality and price fit together.
If you compare our products with our competitor's ones, you easily see that they are shit.
I need to be modest: the volume of features in our products is big.

event.messageBoxA: I heard about your quality, and I am impressed. Can we come together in the future to develop some ideas in a brainstorming session? Here, please take my business card and contact me as soon as possible.
event.messageBoxB: I will contact you as soon as possible directly after the business fair!
Okay, thanks. See you!

event.messageBoxA: Hi! Yes, thanks, do you have some coffee? Today is also the first time for you on this business fair?
event.messageBoxB: I am working for my company for 4 years in Germany, and since a few weeks here in Sweden. How is the business development for you?
I moved here a few weeks ago. How is the business?

event.messageBoxA: Ok %prename%, let's go.
event.messageBoxB: Next

event.messageBoxA: The business development is a long process, that's why I am talking to you. What can you offer me as benefits of a coorporation with your company?
event.messageBoxB: Researches have shown that our product is one of the best in the market. The German engineering is known for its quality and we are set on to keep our reputation clear. Quality and price fit together.
If you compare our products with our competitor's ones, you easily see that they are shit.
I need to be modest: the volume of features in our products is big.

event.messageBoxA: Okay, sounds interesting. Look, I have another contact waiting for me. See you.
event.messageBoxB: See you soon, hopefully!

event.message: MalmöMässan - lunch

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: Hey guys, good work so far. How about taking dinner now? Laura, Lotta? What do you think, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: I can wait, I am not starving.
I am starving, why did you wait so long?

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: How gentlemanly. I discussed it with Lotta, why don't you %prename% and Lotta go now and Hans and I wait for you to come back?
event.messageBoxB: Sounds fine to me. See you later!

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: How gentlemanly. I discussed it with Lotta, why don't you %prename% and Lotta go now and Hans and I wait for you to come back?
event.messageBoxB: Sounds fine to me. See you later!

event.messageBoxA: Hey guys, good work so far. How about taking dinner now? Laura, Lotta? What do you think, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: I can wait, I am not starving.
I am starving, why did you wait so long?

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: How gentlemanly. I discussed it with Lotta, why don't you %prename% and Lotta go now and Hans and I wait for you to come back?
event.messageBoxB: Sounds fine to me. See you later!

event.messageBoxA: How gentlemanly. I discussed it with Lotta, why don't you %prename% and Lotta go now and Hans and I wait for you to come back?
event.messageBoxB: Sounds fine to me. See you later!

event.message: MalmöMässan

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: Välkommen! I am Margareta from datorSE. I haven't seen you here, ever. Are you new around?
event.messageBoxB: Hi Margareta, yes I am. I am from Germany and arrived a few weeks ago in Stockholm, and today for the first time at MalmöMässan. How are you doing?
Halla! I am new, but my company is old. How are you? Have you been here for some times?

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: I am fine, thanks. Yes, I have been here a few times. I know your company, used to like your stuff, but at the moment I prefer your competitors.
event.messageBoxB: I am sorry to hear, what changed your mind?
What a pity, I know all our products and I can assure you, we have the best solutions of the market.
Okay, let's talk about a plan to change this.

event.title: MalmöMässan
event.messageBoxA: I don't mind having no business with you.
event.messageBoxB: You definitely should. I talked to another business man this morning, and we agreed on basis of researches, that our product is one of the best in the market. Quality and price fit.
Okay, don't be stubborn! You need to change your attitude towards our products.
Why don't you have a look on these researches to inform yourself about our newest development?

event.messageBoxA: Let me have a look on them. Sounds interesting, your researches show exactly what we as catorSE need as solutions.
event.messageBoxB: And, look, if you give me your business card, we can arrange a meeting together with some of my people and some of yours. What do you think?
Could this be a basis on a new business development?

event.messageBoxA: Definitely. So, take my business card and call me tomorrow so we can arrange something.
event.messageBoxB: Great, I will call you tomorrow!

event.messageBoxA: I don't mind having no business with you.

event.messageBoxA: Good work from Laura and Lotta, both of you got 2 business cards each. %prename%, you did an excellent job at the business fair and achieved to get 2 business cards! Remember: Sweden do not like conflicts, they enjoy democracy and do not like to interrupt people. They are honest but not rude. You need to take into consideration that Sweden like to do formal agreements. More over, flat hierarchies and openness are lived in Sweden. You definitely deserved your meal. Enjoy!
event.messageBoxB: Finish the day

event.message: Today is your birthday. You are planning a party at your apartment and wonder who you should invite. Besides your colleagues you already met your neighbors and made some friends outside the office. You plan to meet your guests at your place and go out afterwards.

event.title: Invite your guests!
event.description: Choose who you want to invite

event.messageBoxA: Despite Swedish colleagues work together very closely, they separate business and private life strictly. When you invite them to a private occasion, don’t expect them to come. They will probably refuse gently. When it comes to neighbors, Swedes are very conservative. They say during the first year, Swedish neighbors greet each other over the fence. During the second year, they talk about the weather and from the third year on they invite each to their home.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.title: Do your shopping!
event.description: Your Swedish friends accepted the invitation. The guests will come tonight at 9 p.m. and you need to do some preparation. What will you buy for the party?

event.messageBoxA: In Sweden beer, wine, liquor and other alcoholic drinks are very expensive because of high taxes. That’s why it is normal to bring your own alcoholic drinks to a private party or preparty (Swedish: Förefest).
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey %prename%, thanks again for inviting me over. This is a lovely apartment.
event.messageBoxB: I’m glad you made it. Hey, have you heard about the funny picture of princess Victoria?
event.messageBoxA: Yes. But tell me %prename%, do you watch soccer?
event.messageBoxB: Well, yes I do, but …

event.messageBoxA: Why did Pontus change the subject so quickly? Well, as a foreigner you should be careful about what topics you talk about. Talking about the royal family in a bad way is an absolute taboo. Which topics you could talk about instead?
event.messageBoxB: Sports, countryside, spare time activities, traditions
Politics, economy, social topics

event.messageBoxA: Good choice! Swedish people are really into soccer and ice hockey and they love their beautiful countryside. Politics, economy and other social topics are very complex and difficult to understand. Swedes are annoyed when you talk about these topics with superfi-cial knowledge.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Be careful! Politics, economy and other social topics are very complex and difficult to understand. Swedes are annoyed when you talk about these topics with superficial knowledge. Besides Swedes are really into soccer and ice hockey and they love their beau-tiful countryside. Rather talk about this.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.message: The party went on for a couple of hours.

event.description: A few days later in the office
event.messageBoxA: Hi %prename%, the business faire is over and we gathered lots of contacts for potential customers.
event.messageBoxB: Hello Hans. Yes, the fair went pretty well. I think now is the time to get in touch with them and sell our products.
event.messageBoxA: Sounds good. How are we going to handle this?
event.messageBoxB: Well, let me think about it ...

event.messageBoxA: Midsummer is about to come. How will start to organize the project to get in touch with the potential customers?
event.messageBoxB: Inform all colleagues directly and start contacting the potential customers.
Work out a strategy with Lotta until next week. Then inform all colleagues about the strategy you developed and start working.

event.messageBoxA: Good decision! Because of the low Power-distance Swedes have a flat hierarchy. All colleagues are usually informed or even involved in decision making. They tend to work together closely.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Reconsider your decision. Keep the flat hierarchy in mind. You should rather involve your team directly in decision making or at least inform them about the latest decisions. Besides that Swedes are more comfortable with start working instead of “wasting time” with planning. Also most of the Swedish population stops working for a few weeks in midsummer to take holidays. Because of this not only your team will be understaffed during this period, also potential customers are more likely to be not available.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey , %prename%! Some colleagues are going to have a special lunch outside the office, will you join?
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for inviting me, I would like to. Why is it special?
event.messageBoxA: Well, this lunch beat thing was invented here in Sweden in 2010. Many of our foreign colleagues don’t know how to react to this special lunch.
event.messageBoxB: What is it?

event.messageBoxA: At lunch beat, you’re clubbing while lunch. You dance, you talk and eat some delicious finger food. Today our new clients will join us, and our whole management team, too.
event.messageBoxB: Okay, sounds interesting, let’s do this!
Lunch beats? Oh yes, let’s get wasted!
I don’t like to dance, I feel embarrassed.. And our clients too? Oh my gosh!

event.messageBoxA: Nice! Meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator so we can go there.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Keep calm, little Mick Jagger! Anyway, meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator!
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: You don’t have to own the dancefloor, just keep the rhythm. Meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator!
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hello there, nice to meet you here! are you ready to dance?
event.messageBoxB: Of course, even if it feels unusual for me. In Germany we go clubbing just at night. It will be a nice experience though!
Yes, but I am hungry so let’s start with the lunch!
Oh well, don’t expect much dancing from my side, I hate to dance.

event.messageBoxA: Choose your behavior!
event.messageBoxB: I can dance a lot. Also, I see someone special on the other side of the dancefloor and neglect my colleagues as well as my clients.
I'm not in the mood to dance (and also I'm too shy) and stay alone at the buffet.
I try to do my best and talk with my new clients about other leisure time activities while dancing smoothly.

event.messageBoxA: Choose your behavior!
event.messageBoxB: I can dance a lot. Also, I see someone special on the other side of the dancefloor and neglect my colleagues as well as my clients.

event.messageBoxA: What are your holiday plans for this summer, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: I am taking off one week to discover the country and the landscape of northern Sweden.
event.messageBoxA: Sounds nice! You have to go to see the Northern Lights!
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for the advice. See you later!

event.message: Later, back in the office

event.messageBoxA: About the project we talked this morning: How should we get in touch with the potential customers?
event.messageBoxB: Design and send a formal letter to all of them at once.
Call them one by one and have a personal conversation.

event.messageBoxA: You should reconsider your decision. Swedes are more likely to be informal in business life. A formal letter tend be less attractive then a personal conversation.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Good decision! Swedes are more likely to be informal in business life. A personal conversation is the better way to attract customers.
event.messageBoxB: Okay.

event.messageBoxA: Nice work, %prename%. The team is already in contact with some potential customers.
event.messageBoxB: Thank you, Hans. It looks like this is going well so far. I wanted to talk to you today, anyway. I received an e-mail this morning from the headquarters in Germany. I need to come back as soon as possible, because I will be assigned to another subsidiary.
event.messageBoxA: Oh well, then I officially thank you for your work here. I hope we will be in touch soon.
event.messageBoxB: It was a pleasure to work with you and your team.

event.title: WorldMap
event.description: Where on the Cultural World Map is Sweden?

event.description26: Give it a try! Rate country Sweden in each of the 9 Dimensions.

event.message: The journey begins...
The ferry arrives at the harbor of Stockholm. Your new colleagues are waiting.

event.messageBoxA: Välkommen %prename% to our beautiful country Sweden! My name is Hans, I am the manager of sales department. This is Lotta, head of the subsidiary here in Sweden. We are two of your new colleagues!
event.messageBoxB: Hi, I am %prename%, it's a pleasure to meet you!

event.messageBoxA: How was your journey, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: There were no problems, I enjoyed the panoramic view.
Pretty bad, unfortunately I got seasick. That's your fault because of your strange traditional ferry.

event.messageBoxA: I feel sorry for you, I know exactly what you mean, I get seasick every time. That's why I travel by plane or car.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hi, I am Lotta. It is a pleasure to meet you. Well, we ordered a taxi which brings you to your accommodation and afterwards to the office. Tonight we would like to invite you to a typical Swedish tradition. We will have a sauna with some colleagues to get to know each other. It would be great if you join us.
event.messageBoxB: Thank you for inviting me. I am looking forward to join you. I really like that.
Sure, that sounds nice, thank you!
No, I don't like sauna.
Oh,well .. I don't know .. I'd rather rest after this long journey.

event.messageBoxA: Oh no, we scheduled this get-together especially for you. It would be really sad if you couldn't make it. Please reconsider your decision.
event.messageBoxB: All right, let's do this.
Okay, if you insist I will join you!

event.messageBoxA: Perfect, that will be fun! Let's meet up at 6 p.m. at Hellasgarden. See you later! Hej da!
event.messageBoxB: Okay see you!

event.messageBoxA: Välkommen to a typical Swedish sauna, %prename%. You already know Lotta, please meet Laura, our German colleague.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey , %prename%, nice to meet you. I have been working here for a few months.
event.messageBoxB: Hi Laura, it's a pleasure. It's getting pretty hot in here, isn't it? Eh .. I mean .. the sauna. Do you do that regularly?

event.messageBoxA: Yes, that's totally normal in our team. Has everything worked out after we left you at the harbor? I'm curious, how is your accommodation?
event.messageBoxB: The taxi driver was funny, and the accommodation is perfect.
Yes, thanks for the organization!
No! I think I paid way too much, why did you chose this driver? But with the accommodation everything is fine.
The apartment is pretty nice, but I have to say: It looks like an Ikea catalog. However, the area around it seems beautiful. It is located near the Nobelmuseum.

event.messageBoxA: Oh cool! Indeed, it is one of the most beautiful areas in Stockholm. And I live there as well. I can give you some advice for grovery shopping, restaurants and bars, if you like.
event.messageBoxB: Yes, that would be great.

event.messageBoxA: Toppen! I have to say: That's a glorious team; I'm really looking forward to collaborate with you. How about we have something to eat now? We could have a Falafel, that's typical Swedish. Stockholm's best one is just around the corner.
event.messageBoxB: So come on, let's go.

event.message: Conference room - MalmöMässan preparation

event.messageBoxA: Good morning together! Thanks for being punctual. We want to welcome our new colleague %prename% once again. Now to the business: as all of you know, our sales department here in Stockholm was established not very long ago. But nevertheless our German general management says that it cannot be seen as an excuse for our bad figures. In the upcoming months there are many business fairs where we need to develop new business contacts. This is where our new German colleague fits in the story: %prename% will be responsible for the whole client communication for the HQ while I will be representing our sales office here in Stockholm. Now it's up to you, %prename%!
event.messageBoxB: Thank you for the introduction!

Also from my part a very Välkommen. The next few months will be an interesting experience for me. I hope everything will become well and in the end we will be successful. But now, enough for the talking, let's focus on the preparation for the business fair in two weeks in Malmö!
Talk to Lotta

event.messageBoxA: %prename%, please meet me in my office after this discussion. You need to design our new business cards!
event.messageBoxB: Okay!

event.messageBoxA: Hi! Thanks for meeting me here so quickly. The task is to redesign our new business cards. Can you take a look on this topic?
event.messageBoxB: Let's do this!

event.title: Business card draft
event.description: Please design our new business cards. Which elements should be on the business card?

event.messageBoxA: Good job! In Sweden, titles are not so important due to the flat hierarchies in business life. Do you remember? Power distance in Sweden in the 9 Dimensions Quiz was ranked low.
event.messageBoxB: Okay!

event.message: MalmöMässan

event.messageBoxA: Welcome everybody! Thanks for joining to the MalmöMässan! Our focus today is on some maybe in the future clients. Leader is %prename%, the team consists of Lotta and Laura, too. Nu går vi, let's go!
event.messageBoxB: Next

event.messageBoxA: For the first day of this business fair, I prepared a little game: the one of us, who receives the most of the business cards of our clients gets a meal on my costs.
event.messageBoxB: Go and talk to Gunnar

event.messageBoxA: Hi there! I am Gunnar from SvenskeIT. Nice to meet you!
event.messageBoxB: Hi Gunnar, nice to meet you, I am %prename%. How are you doing? Did your day begin well?
Hi Gunnar, I am not a fan of small talk, so let's talk business.
Hi Gunnar, I am %prename%. Can I offer you a drink? Is everything okay?

event.messageBoxA: Yes, thanks. I am fine. It's the first time for us at this business fair, we are new on the market. Since when are you working for Tyron Technologies?
event.messageBoxB: I have been working for my company for four years in Germany, and since a few weeks here in Sweden. How is the business development for you?
I moved here a few weeks ago. How is the business?

event.messageBoxA: The business development is a long process, that's why I am talking to you. What can you offer me as benefits of a coorporation with your company?
event.messageBoxB: Researches have shown that our product is one of the best in the market. The German engineering is known for its quality and we are set on to keep our reputation clear. Quality and price fit together.
If you compare our products with our competitor's ones, you easily see that they are shit.
I need to be modest: the volume of features in our products is big.

event.messageBoxA: I heard about your quality, and I am impressed. Can we come together in the future to develop some ideas in a brainstorming session? Here, please take my business card and contact me as soon as possible.
event.messageBoxB: I will contact you as soon as possible directly after the business fair!
Okay, thanks. See you!

event.messageBoxA: Hi! Yes, thanks, do you have some coffee? Today is also the first time for you on this business fair?
event.messageBoxB: I am working for my company for 4 years in Germany, and since a few weeks here in Sweden. How is the business development for you?
I moved here a few weeks ago. How is the business?

event.messageBoxA: Ok %prename%, let's go.
event.messageBoxB: Next

event.messageBoxB: Researches have shown that our product is one of the best in the market. The German engineering is known for its quality and we are set on to keep our reputation clear. Quality and price fit together.
If you compare our products with our competitor's ones, you easily see that they are shit.
I need to be modest: the volume of features in our products is big.

event.messageBoxA: Okay, sounds interesting. Look, I have another contact waiting for me. See you.
event.messageBoxB: See you soon, hopefully!

event.messageBoxB: I can wait, I am not starving.
I am starving, why did you wait so long?

event.messageBoxA: How gentlemanly. I discussed it with Lotta, why don't you %prename% and Lotta go now and Hans and I wait for you to come back?

event.message: Today is your birthday. You are planning a party at your apartment and wonder who you should invite. Besides your colleagues you already met your neighbors and made some friends outside the office. You plan to meet your guests at your place and go out afterwards.

event.title: Invite your guests!
event.description: Choose who you want to invite

event.messageBoxA: Despite Swedish colleagues work together very closely, they separate business and private life strictly. When you invite them to a private occasion, don’t expect them to come. They will probably refuse gently. When it comes to neighbors, Swedes are very conservative. They say during the first year, Swedish neighbors greet each other over the fence. During the second year, they talk about the weather and from the third year on they invite each to their home.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.title: Do your shopping!
event.description: Your Swedish friends accepted the invitation. The guests will come tonight at 9 p.m. and you need to do some preparation. What will you buy for the party?

event.messageBoxA: In Sweden beer, wine, liquor and other alcoholic drinks are very expensive because of high taxes. That’s why it is normal to bring your own alcoholic drinks to a private party or preparty (Swedish: Förefest).
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey %prename%, thanks again for inviting me over. This is a lovely apartment.
event.messageBoxB: I’m glad you made it. Hey, have you heard about the funny picture of princess Victoria?
event.messageBoxA: Yes. But tell me %prename%, do you watch soc-cer?
event.messageBoxB: Well, yes I do, but …

event.messageBoxA: Why did Pontus change the subject so quickly? Well, as a foreigner you should be careful about what topics you talk about. Talking about the royal family in a bad way is an absolute taboo. Which topics you could talk about instead?
event.messageBoxB: Sports, countryside, spare time activities, traditions
Politics, economy, social topics

event.messageBoxA: Good choice! Swedish people are really into soccer and ice hockey and they love their beautiful countryside. Politics, economy and other social topics are very complex and difficult to understand. Swedes are annoyed when you talk about these topics with superfi-cial knowledge.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Be careful! Politics, economy and other social topics are very complex and difficult to understand. Swedes are annoyed when you talk about these topics with superficial knowledge. Besides Swedes are really into soccer and ice hockey and they love their beau-tiful countryside. Rather talk about this.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.message: The party went on for a couple of hours.

event.description: A few days later in the office
event.messageBoxA: Hi %prename%, the business faire is over and we gathered lots of contacts for potential customers.
event.messageBoxB: Hello Hans. Yes, the fair went pretty well. I think now is the time to get in touch with them and sell our products.
event.messageBoxA: Sounds good. How are we going to handle this?
event.messageBoxB: Well, let me think about it ...

event.messageBoxA: Midsummer is about to come. How will start to organize the project to get in touch with the potential customers?
event.messageBoxB: Inform all colleagues directly and start contacting the potential customers.
Work out a strategy with Lotta until next week. Then inform all colleagues about the strategy you developed and start working.

event.messageBoxA: Good decision! Because of the low Power-distance Swedes have a flat hierarchy. All colleagues are usually informed or even involved in decision making. They tend to work together closely.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Reconsider your decision. Keep the flat hierarchy in mind. You should rather involve your team directly in decision making or at least inform them about the latest decisions. Besides that Swedes are more comfortable with start working instead of “wasting time” with planning. Also most of the Swedish population stops working for a few weeks in midsummer to take holidays. Because of this not only your team will be understaffed during this period, also potential customers are more likely to be not available.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hey , %prename%! Some colleagues are going to have a special lunch outside the office, will you join?
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for inviting me, I would like to. Why is it special?
event.messageBoxA: Well, this lunch beat thing was invented here in Sweden in 2010. Many of our foreign colleagues don’t know how to react to this special lunch.
event.messageBoxB: What is it?

event.messageBoxA: At lunch beat, you’re clubbing while lunch. You dance, you talk and eat some delicious finger food. Today our new clients will join us, and our whole management team, too.
event.messageBoxB: Okay, sounds interesting, let’s do this!
Lunch beats? Oh yes, let’s get wasted!
I don’t like to dance, I feel embarrassed.. And our clients too? Oh my gosh!

event.messageBoxA: Nice! Meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator so we can go there.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Keep calm, little Mick Jagger! Anyway, meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator!
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: You don’t have to own the dancefloor, just keep the rhythm. Meet us at 12:00 downstairs at the elevator!
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Hello there, nice to meet you here! are you ready to dance?
event.messageBoxB: Of course, even if it feels unusual for me. In Germany we go clubbing just at night. It will be a nice experience though!
Yes, but I am hungry so let’s start with the lunch!
Oh well, don’t expect much dancing from my side, I hate to dance.

event.messageBoxA: Choose your behavior!
event.messageBoxB: I can dance a lot. Also, I see someone special on the other side of the dancefloor and neglect my colleagues as well as my clients.
I'm not in the mood to dance (and also I'm too shy) and stay alone at the buffet.
I try to do my best and talk with my new clients about other leisure time activities while dancing smoothly.

event.messageBoxA: What are your holiday plans for this summer, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: I am taking off one week to discover the country and the landscape of northern Sweden.
event.messageBoxA: Sounds nice! You have to go to see the Northern Lights!
event.messageBoxB: Thanks for the advice. See you later!

event.message: Later, back in the office

event.messageBoxA: About the project we talked this morning: How should we get in touch with the potential customers?
event.messageBoxB: Design and send a formal letter to all of them at once.
Call them one by one and have a personal conversation.

event.messageBoxA: You should reconsider your decision. Swedes are more likely to be informal in business life. A formal letter tend be less attractive then a personal conversation.
event.messageBoxB: Okay

event.messageBoxA: Good decision! Swedes are more likely to be informal in business life. A personal conversation is the better way to attract customers.
event.messageBoxB: Okay.

event.messageBoxA: Nice work, %prename%. The team is already in contact with some potential customers.
event.messageBoxB: Thank you, Hans. It looks like this is going well so far. I wanted to talk to you today, anyway. I received an e-mail this morning from the headquarters in Germany. I need to come back as soon as possible, because I will be assigned to another subsidiary.
event.messageBoxA: Oh well, then I officially thank you for your work here. I hope we will be in touch soon.
event.messageBoxB: It was a pleasure to work with you and your team.

event.messageBoxA: You successfully played the Swedish part of this game!

event.message: After a belated flight, you finally arrive at the airport of Washington D.C. You are about to be leading a small marketing team on your own in a subsidiary abroad. Because of the delay, you don’t have much time to get ready for the business dinner with your new teammates which you set up before without considering a delay on your flight details. As soon as you get your baggage, James, the driver is waiting for you in the waiting area at the airport with a welcome sign and your name on it. While you greet him, James is helping you with your luggage.

Even though the ride to the hotel takes only about ten minutes you don’t have much time left to get ready because of the delay of your flight. After dismissing your driver and a short check-in procedure in the lobby, you hurry to your room to get ready for the dinner. Fortunately, the restaurant is nearby. You take a quick shower and get dressed. Afterwards, you rush down the lobby to get the keys for your rental car in which you quickly get to the restaurant. Because it’s rush hour time, you arrive there later than expected, but still on time.
As soon as you arrive, out of the sudden, a college boy appears right next to your car.

event.messageBoxA: Hey, I’m John, how are you?
event.messageBoxB: Hey, my name is %gender% %surname%. Would you mind getting out of my way, I need to find a parking spot, I’m running late.

Hey, I’m %prename%. I’m fine, but running late because of a delayed flight. I’m so nervous; I’m going to meet my teammates for the very first time. Is this even the right restaurant? My GPS is freaking me out.
Thanks, I’m fine. Here are the keys. See you later.

event.messageBoxA: Sir, it is usual to let the valet boy take care of the car from here on. Please hand me over your keys so I can do so. To be sure, you’ll get them back later.
You reached the right restaurant, but keep it cool, you’ll be fine.
See you later.

event.message: As soon as you step into the entrance hall, a Chinese guy is waiting for your arrival already. It is Aang Zhao-Li, your contact person in the USA. In the past months, you have exchanged several e-mails and got in touch with him. Although Mr. Zhao-Li’s outward appearance suggests something else, he truly acts like a real American guy. He was born in the States but his grandfather was a Chinese.

event.messageBoxA: Good evening, my name is Aang Zhao-Li. It is nice to finally meet you in person. You are %gender% %surname%, right?
event.messageBoxB: Yes, I am %prename% %surname%, but you can call me %prename%. The pleasure is all mine.
Yes, I am %gender% %surname%. Nice to meet you too.
Yes, that’s me.

event.message: After both of you have given your jackets to one of the staff members, you already spot the table you booked. Excited and nervous as you are, you ignore the sign ‘Wait to be seated’ and walk straight to your table. With reaching your table a waiter appears to confront you nicely.

event.messageBoxA: Good evening, sir. This table is already taken. May I ask you to wait in the queue to be seated?
event.messageBoxB: I booked this table. So why should I go back? I’m not going to.
So sorry. I didn’t know that I have to wait in the queue, but I, %prename% %surname%, booked that table.
I'm sorry my fault, I am going back to wait in the queue.

event.message: 10 minutes later, Mr. Zhao-Li and you are still waiting for the rest of the team. You are getting impatient, but Mr. Zhao-Li reassures you it’s perfectly normal in the States to appear later than agreed on. Since you two already talked business over a couple of emails you use the time for some small talk.

event.messageBoxA: Tell me %prename%, why did you accept the offer here in the States?
event.messageBoxB: Of course, I’m only doing it for the money. Nothing else matters.
I love my work a lot and especially learning about different cultures with its values. With accepting this offer I see another challenge for me which I’m sure I can handle.
I love to travel and the States have always been a place to be for myself.

event.messageBoxA: I’m sure you’ll earn lots of money in this position.
You’re still young, I’m sure you’ll be doing even more traveling in the future.
I also love to travel. Germany really does sound exciting to me but unfortunately I’ve never made it this far.
Do you have any hobbies?
event.messageBoxB: I do lots of sports at home and would like to do some here as well. I love playing handball, any suggestions?
No, I’m really busy working.
I like the outdoors and meeting with friends.

event.messageBoxA: I know a great sports program nearby. I can ask for a brochure if you want me to.
I get that, work is busy. But for myself even with my busy schedule doing sports gives me the chance handle all the challenges in work and life in general.
We could go out for a walk sometimes if you want to.

event.content: 5 minutes later, the others finally arrive. After a short introduction everyone is sitting at the table. What should you do?
event.option: You tell your team you're angry because they made you wait on your first day.

You are angry for waiting so long but keep it for yourself. After all this is your very first meeting and you don’t want to leave a negative impression. But keeping it for yourself will leave you grumpy for the rest of the evening.
You don't mind the delay of the rest of your team since you were able to chat with Mr. Zhao-Li.

event.message: Because everyone is quite hungry, the team quickly decides to order some food as well as soft drinks. Unfortunately, you are vegetarian, but the menu does not seem to have any options without meat. Besides, the team wants to order a complete Barbecue plate for all of them.

Because everyone is quite hungry, the team quickly decides to order some food as well as soft drinks. You are a vegetarian, but unfortunately the menu does not seem to have any vegetarian dishes. Besides, the team wants to order a complete Barbecue plate for all of them.

Because everyone is quite hungry, the team quickly decides to order some food as well as soft drinks. You are a vegetarian, but unfortunately the menu does not seem to have any vegetarian dishes. Besides, the team wants to order a complete Barbecue plate for all of them.

event.messageBoxA: Ready for some delicious grilled steaks?
event.messageBoxB: Damn restaurant. Why didn’t anyone tell me there is nothing vegetarian to order? Seriously, are there no vegetarians in this whole freaking country?
I’m sorry to say, but this restaurant does not even serve vegetarian dishes. Are you all ok if we just go to the Chinese restaurant nearby? This would be great!
Too bad there’s no vegetarian meal. Guess I’ll just stick with the side dishes. Lucky me I’m craving for some fries. This will be a fantastic evening!

event.message: Nevertheless, the team decided to stay in the restaurant. Even though you would have preferred otherwise, the members became closer quickly while making small talk.

event.messageBoxA: I mean, some of these catastrophes are really terrible, but I guess it’s not God who is responsible for these. People destroy the world, and we have to pay for what we do. Or what do you think, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: You mean, if I believe in God? Actually not, and I can’t understand people who really do. I mean, you are right, that we are responsible for what we do, but God is just an excuse, isn’t it?
It’s not my due to judge people by their beliefs, but sure, everyone is responsible for what he or she is doing.

event.message: Smalltalk continues ...
Smalltalk continues ...

event.messageBoxA: I have to admit that German cars are nicer than American ones. What car are you driving in Germany, %prename%?
event.messageBoxB: I’m driving a BMW so nothing special here.
I’m driving a BMW 5 series, automatic, four-wheel drive and sports line. That think is so fast, runs more than 150 miles per hour.

event.messageBoxA: Awesome! Anyone still thirsty?
event.messageBoxB: Thanks! No thanks, I'm fine. Oh and did you know that they integrated that new button where you can switch between different driving modes, from fuel saving to extra sporty?
Thanks! No thanks, I’m fine.

event.messageBoxA: Fuel-saving sounds great. How about a dessert later?
event.messageBoxB: It’s time for an American cheesecake, I love it.
But you should come to Germany and try the extra sporty option. This will be a complete new experience for you.

event.message: Finally, the food arrives.
Finally, the food arrives.

event.message: The last team member finishes his meal which is followed by the waiter showing up to give you the bill. Still being mad about the plate situation, you are thinking about not or at least giving fewer tips than usual.

The day after you met your team members for the very first time you set up a quick meeting to plan the first few weeks and keep getting to know each other. With you again being on time waiting for your delayed team members you use their delay to grab a cup of coffee and have another look over your topics. 10 minutes later, the whole team arrives and you are about to start.

event.content: You start with: 'Good morning everybody. Thanks again for the great time we had last night getting to know each other off from work ...' How do you continue?
event.option: ... 'Now since we’re all here I’d like to discuss the planning for the next few weeks.'

After the business meeting with Aang Zhao-Li you try to call your boss Mr. Lindner in Germany, but you can’t reach him. The next day you get a call from him.

event.messageBoxA: Hello Mr. Lindner, thanks for your call! How are you?
event.messageBoxB: Hello %prename%, I’m fine and you? How’s the project working? I hope you have great news for me. That’s why you called, right?

event.messageBoxA: I’m good, thanks. Yes, that’s why I’m calling but unfortunately the news isn’t that great. The working method in America is slightly different than in Germany. The process doesn’t get tested as much as in Germany either and there are way less rules for them to follow
event.messageBoxB: How should I understand that?

event.messageBoxA: Aang, the guy you met before, should present a quick progress of the project in yesterday’s morning meeting. The meeting was scheduled for 15 minutes, he filled in some of that time but not with those information I needed. I thought that was clear enough. He said let’s find some ideas and test them straight with our customers. I mean why? They don’t even want to test them first, they just want the customers to know we are the most innovative company. And I missed a lot of other information like who should communicate to whom? And what are the company rules? I mean he didn’t even tell one of the rules. I said I want to get those information but later, since the whole team doesn’t need to be there for that. I just don’t get it! How am I supposed to lead such team so independent and on their own without lots of rules?
event.messageBoxB: Same happened to me when I was abroad. You better talk to Aang in private and set things straight. Tell him in specific which kind of information you need to know. And don’t forget they are just setting different focuses. Their focus is set on quick results and solutions instead of the problems itself and who’s responsible for that. If that’s not possible, please let me know, then I'll talk to the team in America. Americans just do it differently; it’s nothing personal so please take that in mind! Thank you for the update. This project has top priority and has to work; we have a high cost pressure! Is there anything else?

event.messageBoxA: No, that’s it. Thank you for the call and I will call you back as soon as there’s news. Have a nice day, bye!
event.messageBoxB: Thank you %prename%, bye!

event.message: After a belated flight, you finally arrive at the airport of Washington D.C. You are about to be leading a small marketing team on your own in a subsidiary abroad. Because of the delay, you don’t have much time to get ready for the business dinner with your new teammates which you set up before without considering a delay on your flight details. As soon as you get your baggage, James, the driver is waiting for you in the waiting area at the airport with a welcome sign and your name on it. While you greet him, James is helping you with your luggage.

Even though the ride to the hotel takes only about ten minutes you don’t have much time left to get ready because of the delay of your flight. After dismissing your driver and a short check-in procedure in the lobby, you hurry to your room to get ready for the dinner. Fortunately, the restaurant is nearby. You take a quick shower and get dressed. Afterwards, you rush down the lobby to get the keys for your rental car in which you quickly get to the restaurant. Because it’s rush hour time, you arrive there later than expected, but still on time.
As soon as you arrive, out of the sudden, a college boy appears right next to your car.

event.messageBoxA: Hey, I’m John, how are you?

Thanks, I’m fine. Here are the keys. See you later.

You reached the right restaurant, but keep it cool, you’ll be fine.
See you later.

And don’t forget they are just setting different focuses. Their focus is set on quick results and solutions instead of the problems itself and who’s responsible for that. If that’s not possible, please let me know, then I'll talk to the team in America. Americans just do it differently; it’s nothing personal so please take that in mind! Thank you for the update. This project has top priority and has to work; we have a high cost pressure! Is there anything else?

event.messageBoxA: No, that’s it. Thank you for the call and I will call you back as soon as there’s news. Have a nice day, bye!
event.messageBoxB: Thank you %prename%, bye!

event.title: Four ears model
event.option: As his boss Mr. Lindner is delegating the work to you.
The project has a high priority and can’t fail.
You have to ensure that the project continues successfully.
If the project fails, there are high costs for Mr. Lindner and his company.

event.message: Your trip ends here ...

event.content: End the game!
